pageTitle: Later Tube services on Hainault loop

title.title: Later Tube services on Hainault loop

texts: Passengers on the Central line's Hainault loop received a major boost today when London Underground (LU) announced that from 19 November services will operate beyond 8pm between Hainault to Woodford via Roding Valley.
It is our intention to operate this service for the foreseeable future
The improvements are part of Transport for London's (TfL's) £10bn Investment Programme to meet London's transport needs, now and in the future.
At present, Central line services do not serve Grange Hill, Chigwell and Roding Valley stations after 8pm and have not done so for many years.
A new timetable for the Central line will be introduced later this year on 19 November.
One of the major benefits will be that Tube services will operate between Hainault to Woodford via Roding Valley beyond the current 8pm finishing time until close of passenger service.
Jeff Ellis, General Manager, Central line said: "London Underground is working hard to improve the Tube and constantly monitors customer demand to ensure that our services meet passenger needs.
"The new Central line timetable to be introduced later this year will allow us to respond to growing local demand for later services to run between Hainault and Woodford via Roding Valley.
"It is our intention to operate this service for the foreseeable future and we hope it will prove popular with passengers."

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts
